title: Mark Jamra's Expo Serif: Opinions?
content:
While looking over the recent TDC2 2009 Winners I noticed Expo Serif. After printing the sample .pdf and mulling over how this type family looked on the page, I began to realize how well it reads. This font has to be among the most legible and readable I've come across. I usually don't go in for such softly-curved letterforms (save for Kris Sowersby's Feijoa, which I \*love\*), but Expo's getting to me.

[http://www.typeculture.com/foundry/font\_collection/font.php?ID=FNT09\_03](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023082751/http:/www.typeculture.com/foundry/font_collection/font.php?ID=FNT09_03 "http://www.typeculture.com/foundry/font\_collection/font.php?ID=FNT09\_03")

Any thoughts on Expo Serif? I wonder what my typographic betters think of this, so I can learn as well.

Cheers,

Christian.
author: _Palatine_
